intro: Synthyris pinnatifida var. laciniata, commonly known as the cut-leaf synthyris, is a variant of the synthyris plant characterized by its finely dissected, lobed leaves. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodland floors or stream banks. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. The flowers are small and white, arranged in umbels, typical of the family.
